title: Firefox for Android 36.0.3 Release

notes.note:
36.0.3: [Security fixes][1] for issues disclosed at HP Zero Day Initiative's Pwn2Own contest

[1]: https://www.mozilla.org/security/known-vulnerabilities/firefox/#firefox36.0.3

New [Tablet user interface][1]


  [1]: http://lucasr.org/2014/12/03/new-tablet-ui-for-firefox-on-android/
Support for the full HTTP/2 protocol. HTTP/2 enables a faster, more scalable, and more responsive web.
Locale added: Maithili (mai) (Android Lollipop only)
No longer accept insecure RC4 ciphers whenever possible

[Phasing out Certificates][1] with 1024-bit RSA Keys


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/security/2015/01/28/phase-2-phasing-out-certificates-with-1024-bit-rsa-keys/

[Add-on Compatibility][1]


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/addons/2015/01/13/compatibility-for-firefox-36/

Support for the [ECMAScript 6 Symbol][1] data type added

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol

[unicode-range CSS descriptor][1] implemented


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/unicode-range

[object-fit][1] and [object-position][2] implemented.
Defines how and where the content of a replaced element is displayed [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-position

[isolation CSS][1] property implemented.
Create a new stacking context to isolate groups of boxes to control which blend together [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/isolation

CSS3 [will-change property][1] implemented.
Hints the browser of elements that will be modified. The browser will perform some performance optimization for these [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/will-change

[Improved ES6 generators][1] for better performance


  [1]: https://wingolog.org/archives/2014/11/14/generators-in-firefox-now-twenty-two-times-faster

Changed JavaScript ['const' semantics][1] to conform better to the ES6 specification.
The const declaration is now block-scoped and requires an initializer. It also can not be redeclared anymore. [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/const

36.0.2 - Fix a startup crash on HTC One M8 devices (Verizon) with Android 5.0.1 ([1140830][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1140830

36.0.2 - Fix some potential crashes with Flash videos ([1118216][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1118216

36.0.1 - Disable the usage of the ANY DNS query type ([1093983][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1093983

36.0.1 - WebGL may use significant memory with Canvas2d ([1137251][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1137251

36.0.1 - Accept hostnames that include an underscore character ("_") ([1136616][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1136616
Various security fixes

[CSS gradients][1] work on premultiplied colors


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/gradient
DNS resolution when using VPNs or switching networks
Fix some unexpected logout from Facebook or Google after restart

January Chromecast firmware update broke tab mirroring ([1131084][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/1131084

On Android 2.3, 3.0 and 4.0, some WebM videos cannot be read properly ([1131563][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1131563

Style Editor: Extra white space appearing above the editor for a sourcemapped scss file ([1128747][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1128747

text: We'd also like to extend a special thank you to all of the new Mozillians who contributed to this release of Firefox!
